Drinking more water may help with chronic pain management in certain situations. Chronic pain may be caused by conditions that require adequate hydration to function properly; for example, dehydration can cause muscle cramps, headaches and other types of pain. Additionally, water helps to lubricate your joints, which can help to decrease joint pain. 

Proper hydration is important for overall health, including pain management. However, drinking more water alone may not necessarily be sufficient as a singular answer to chronic pain, especially if it is caused by an underlying medical condition. Conversing with your healthcare provider about the types of pain you are experiencing, and developing a pain management plan that meets your specific needs is recommended.
